individual_metadata.synopsis: Two surly duergar with foul mouths order a gnome slave around. Both should sound DRUNK, loud and obnoxious as they demand a refil from the gnome. Player can assert how they feel about the enslaving of the gnome.
individual_metadata.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto -605.444; 5.317; 384.94. Talk to Ward Magmar

automatic_ordering.reasoning: Only one session is provided in the data (with an empty string as its key). There is no evidence of any ordering requirement between sessions or any mutually exclusive sessions because no additional session data is available. Thus, no ordering or exclusivity constraints can be deduced.

53.speaker: Ward Magmar
53.context:
CinematicNodeContext: To Skickpit

Stickpit is collecting empty tankards from Magmar and PistleNodeContext: VO NOTE:Magmar should sound drunk

21.speaker: Skickpit
21.context:
CinematicNodeContext: To Magmar

Stickpit walks off screen with both mugs

6.speaker: Ward Magmar
6.text: Now jump to it, or it's up the lift and straight to the shadows.
6.context: CinematicNodeContext: To SkickpitNodeContext: To Skickpit

15.speaker: Wyll
15.text: Damned slavers. Just the sight of them turns my stomach.

31.speaker: Shadowheart
31.text: If I was that slave, I'd be tempted to add a dash of something poisonous to their drinks.

8.speaker: Karlach
8.text: Cruelty like that poisons the soul 'til one day, you drop dead - or the person you're fucking with snaps and puts a sword in your eye.

18.speaker: Ward Magmar
18.text: Heard you caused a ruckus. But I'm keeping my butt planted.

42.speaker: Ward Magmar
42.text: Heard you tore Nere t'bits. But that don't make us friends.

66.speaker: Ward Pistle
66.context: CinematicNodeContext: Talking to Magmaer but looking at player.NodeContext: Pistle note: Pistle is drunk and rowdy

0.speaker: Ward Magmar
0.text: Don't I wish. The gnome's a True Soul.

74.speaker: Ward Pistle
74.context: NodeContext: Should sound drunk and dissapointed

70.speaker: Ward Magmar
70.text: Prick-squeak - go tell your True Soul chums we won't move a pebble.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: Your captive is most entertaining. How might I get one of my own?

19.speaker: Ward Magmar
19.text: You just take one. They're swarming the place!

68.speaker: Ward Magmar
68.text: They'll squirm a bit, maybe give you some lip.

72.speaker: Ward Magmar
72.text: 'Course at your size, might be tough pinning 'em down. Would pay to see it, not gonna lie.

48.speaker: Wyll
48.text: Some thoughts aren't meant to be said aloud. That was one of them.

64.speaker: Wyll
64.text: Next time your mind sinks that low, keep things to yourself.

73.speaker: Ward Magmar
73.text: All it takes is a stiff crop to get 'em in line.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: A True Soul is trapped in a cave-in. Shouldn't you be digging him out?

44.speaker: Player
44.text: I heard a True Soul was trapped. Shouldn't you be helping?

24.speaker: Ward Pistle
24.text: You heard the man. Let's see 'em.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: You want to see my hands? What for?

1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player holds out hands to the duergar. They look them over.

12.speaker: Ward Magmar
12.text: Five workin' fingers. Nice and meaty, prime for digging.

75.speaker: Ward Magmar
75.text: You want Nere, you claw him out. My drinking hand's busy.

51.speaker: Ward Magmar
51.text: And I don't like pigshit, but damned if your mouth ain't spewing it.

32.speaker: Ward Magmar
32.text: You want respect? Let your Absolute pay for it. 'Til then, bugger off.

16.speaker: Skickpit
16.context:
CinematicNodeContext: To Magmar

Stickpit returns with two beer mugsNodeContext: Snide

67.speaker: Ward Magmar
67.text: Stickshit talks like Smug when he wrecked that 'shroom village...
67.context:
CinematicNodeContext: To Pistle

Stickpit hands over beer mug off screen to pistleNodeContext: Starting to laugh as you tell a 'joke', drunk and laughing

69.speaker: Ward Pistle
69.context:
CinematicNodeContext: To Magmar

Stickpit hands over beer mug to MagmarNodeContext: pissing laughing at Magmar. The joke doesn't even make sense but it's hilarious to pistle

57.speaker: Ward Magmar
57.context:
CinematicNodeContext: To Pistle

Magmar and Pistle both holding beermugsNodeContext: Toasting to a dead colleague

62.context: CinematicNodeContext: The two duergar take a drink and set their mugs down.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: You're quite the blowhard. I can appreciate that.

40.speaker: Ward Magmar
40.text: Then you'll appreciate how few shits I have to give ya.

47.speaker: Ward Magmar
47.text: Laduguer's guts - it's time I shut you up.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: Frown and keep your hands to yourself.

17.speaker: Ward Magmar
17.text: Scowl all you want. You got five workin' fingers, perfect for digging.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: How dare you enslave my people? They deserve dignity, not servitude.

28.speaker: Ward Magmar
28.text: Look at ya. Like a slab of cold iron come to life. Made for hard labour.

14.speaker: Ward Magmar
14.text: Moan all you want - we're born with parts to play. I was born a master, and Stickshit was born a slave.

20.speaker: Ward Magmar
20.text: That's just the way of it.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: Enslaving the meek? I see you live up to your cruel reputation.

3.speaker: Ward Magmar
3.text: Look at the top-dwarf getting all judgy. Not like you lot came to our rescue when mind flayers yoked us.

37.speaker: Ward Magmar
37.text: You want bygones staying bygones? You keep to your business, and we'll keep to ours.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: Your slave was made to toil. You're squandering him on mundane tasks.

60.speaker: Ward Magmar
60.text: You can't swing a greataxe without hittin' a pocket-runt. Stickshit won't be missed.

41.speaker: Ward Magmar
41.text: Besides, nothin' mundane about serving good brew. Stuff's the balm of life, and Stickshit there's got the honour.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: You disgust me, slaver. How do you live with yourself?

50.speaker: Ward Magmar
50.text: I kick up my feet, order a brew, watch 'em work. They'll complain, but they love it, I'm telling you.

38.speaker: Ward Magmar
38.text: Prick-squeak - tell the sergeant we won't move a pebble 'til we're paid.

4.speaker: Ward Magmar
4.text: True Soul, yeah? Tell your chums we won't move a pebble.

33.speaker: Ward Magmar
33.text: True Soul, yeah? Tell the sergeant we won't move a pebble.

46.speaker: Astarion
46.text: Now that's how you motivate the staff.

10.speaker: Lae'zel
10.text: A waste of a slave. He should be digging or scavenging, not... serving drinks.

34.speaker: Gale
34.text: I think we've found two duergar who are going to get spit in their drinks.
